did.head: Overview

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Stanford University. Program in the History and Philosophy of Science and Technology.

did.unittitle: Stanford University, Program in History and Philosophy of Science and Technology, honors theses
did.abstract: Honors theses by students in the Stanford University Program in History and Philosophy of Science and Technology.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Theses were transferred to the Stanford University Archives from the Hume Writing Center in 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research use; materials must be requested at least 48 hours in advance of intended use. No photocopies may be made.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright is retained by the creator for materials they have authored or otherwise produced. Transmission or reproduction of materials requires the written permission of the copyright owner.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Stanford University, Program in History and Philosophy of Science and Technology, honors theses (SC4-3449). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of honors theses by students in the Stanford University Program in History and Philosophy of Science and Technology.

did.unittitle: Flocks, Sally, Ideology without revolution: feminists' attitudes towards motherhood and child-rearing 1888-1920.
Klein, Patrick F., Cold War liberalism: American liberal social thought in the 1950's.
Payne, Marshall, Anglo-American cooperation in atomic energy research 1943-1947.
Cushing, Mark L., The American liberal Catholic tradition, 1880-1965: a study of the ideas of John Ireland, John Ryan, and John Courtney Murray.
Silverman, Scott, Chester Rowell and reform in Fresno, California: 1898-1905.
